story:
As of right now, there are only two things in this world that I am absolutely sure of:

  • The first is that hundreds of thousands of West Virginians are currently suffering the effects of a massive chemical spill that has proven to be the most hazardous environmental crisis in the United States since the BP Gulf Oil Disaster, and that this crisis has garnered a collective "meh", from the national news media who prefer to spend their time speculating about who's running for President in 2016 and what specific drugs Jacqueline Bisset was on during her Golden Globes acceptance speech.
  • The second is that I cannot grow a proper beard to save my life.
Now, to the untrained eye, it would seem as though these two things have absolutely nothing in common. On the one hand, you have an environmental disaster wherein up to 7,500 gallons of 4-methylcyclohexane, a chemical used by coal companies in washing off all of the waste particles that cling to newly mined coal, was leaked into the Elk River, almost immediately tainting the water supply of about 300,000 West Virginians in and around Charleston. On the other, you have a genetic makeup that does not allow me to grow a full, lush, Grizzly Adams type beard, but rather, a patchy, vaguely post-pubescent facial abomination that looks like a Chia Pet that hasn't been watered properly. And, up until today, that untrained eye would have been right in thinking these facts to be unrelated...but not anymore. Because today is the start of the:

First Inaugural Mountaineer Bad Beard-Off for Clean Water

"What is the First Inaugural Mountaineer Bad Beard-Off?", you conveniently and theoretically ask.

Well! It is an epic battle betwixt man and nature, in which I don't shave for 30 days and post pictures of how ridiculous and unfortunate I look in exchange for your hard earned Samolians, which will then go to The West Virginia Clean Water Hub (https://www.facebook.com/WVCleanWaterHub) and the Keeper of the Mountains Foundation (http://www.mountainkeeper.org/), who will then use that money to buy for thousands of West Virginia residents such essentials as:

  • Bottled Water
  • Hand Sanitizer
  • Gallons of Drinking and Spring Water
  • Disinfecting Wipes
  • Did I mention that they need water?
Right now, even after the West Virginia American Water Company and West Virginia State Officials have removed do-not-use orders on the areas affected by the spill, the water supply is still causing harmful side effects such as nausea and skin irritation, and the lack of research on 4-methylcyclohexane means that we have no idea what the long term and teratogenic effects of these chemicals are.

So, my fellow Americans, support your brothers and sisters in West Virginia by supporting the slow disappearance of anything remotely approaching attractiveness on my face by giving money in proportion to the amount of unsightly facial hair I am able to grow.

What will you get for your support, I mean besides the satisfaction of knowing that you have provided the most vital element of life to people in need of charitable assistance?

Well, for starters, you will get daily updates of my progress (or regress, depending on your point of view) on my long journey to bearddom, most of which can be found at this site and on my blog (www.virallysuppressed.com). You will also receive updates on the situation on the ground in West Virginia, including a chance to see exactly where and who your generous donations are going to help.

Update, 1/25/14:


Here are more photos from West Virginia of some of the water and baby wipes and such that have been purchased and distributed using money that came from the 1st Inaugural Mountaineer Bad Beard-Off for Clean Water.

If you haven't donated yet, I urge you to consider it, even if it's only a dollar or two...it makes a difference.




Update, 1/22/14:

Ladies and Gentlemen,

In addition to the 1st Inaugural Mountaineer Bad Beard-Off for Clean Water, I give you the 1st Inaugural Mountaineer Sugarless Gummi Bear Eat-Off for Clean Water.

What does a this Gummi Bear Eat-Off entail?

Well, for every 5 dollars you donate to help provide clean drinking and bathing water for the people of west virginia, i will eat one sugarless haribo gummi bear, up to 200 gummi bears. 


This may sound like a lot of money per bear, but if the amazon reviews (http://slightlyviral.com/beware-sugarless-gummy...) are any indication, just 20 of these little bastards can make your colon explode. Seriously, these Gummi Bears are the spawn of Satan and I will eat them for your perverse, vicarious enjoyment in exchange for donations to help the 300,000 plus West Virginians who have been without clean water for nearly two weeks now.

So make a donation now specifying that you're contributing to the sugarless gummi bear eat-off and know that even 5 measly dollars could result in unparalleled gastrointestinal internet hilarity!

story:
What would happen if we had an army of young people with the courage, critical thinking, training and sheer inspiration to solve our most pressing global issues?

We would change the world!

The Molina Center is building a place which equalizes opportunity for young people, breaking at-risk youth out of chronic poverty, homelessness and unemployment and tuning them into the reality that solving global challenges locally has a neat side-effect: employment, education and a brighter future for all.

We will engage at-risk youth with paid internships in sustainability - a long-term transitional residential program running every aspect of our social enterprise businesses. Working as a team in an entrepreneurial environment where everyone is encouraged and supported to consider their reach and capacity to make a lasting difference. Within a real eco-village community that gives full support for our interns to run every aspect of our business and community life.

Yes, real paid internships for at-risk youth.

With all the wholistic structure and support needed to ensure lasting success.

If you are an intern coming to live and work at The Molina Center:

  • we will meet you where you are - now, and move with you to the future you want
  • we will create mentoring partnerships with key experts in the local community
  • we will recognize that you are a complex being, and work with you to address the root causes of emotional distress and under-achievement
  • you are a valued member of our team, and have great insight and energy to give
  • we will ensure that you are secure financially, comfortably housed, eat good food and are part of a dynamic and inspirational community

What We Have Now:

  • the land: 42 beautiful acres in western Colorado held free and clear by our 501(c)(3) non-profit
  • the facility: two main buildings (one brand new!), plus a number of smaller ones, all the infrastructure in place
  • the people: a well-credentialed board hailing from around the USA, an Executive Director from Australia, a qualified chef to make that good food, community and industry partners and a diverse network of volunteers and supporters
  • the programs: two thoroughly researched and innovative programs - Food Foresters (Permaculture and Urban Gardening) and Natural Builders (sustainable building pre-vocational program)
  • the youth: we already have enough potential interns to book us out several times over

We Need Your Help With:

  • operational funding: startup money to pay our new staff, interns, insurance, materials (once we are established we should be self-sustaining)
  • credibility: we have already spoken to a number of grant-making foundations - the common thread has been "show us that you have broad, grassroots support and get back to us" - they are enthusiastic and keen to help, but no-one wants to be the first in to support a new approach

Hence this crowdfunding campaign. After several years of planning, hundreds of  thousands of dollars worth of private financial and in-kind donations and support, we are coming out of "stealth mode" and asking for your - the general public's - support.

As soon as we reach $30,000 on this campaign, we can start our programs.

However - we need to raise $300,000 to be sure that we can continue operations in the long term - we will be working intensely to push our campaign to this goal!  Raising up to or beyond $300,000 will ensure that we have enough to fund operations well into 2015 and convince grant-making foundations that we are a safe investment, so that we can continue to inspire many more at-risk youth into the future.

If you can't afford a donation, then share this with your friends. Even just talking about us - saying "check out The Molina Center, they are doing cool stuff" to everyone you know - will make a real difference to our collective future. Check out our Referral Prizes shown at the end of this page to see how we will thank you for your support.

Where the Money Goes:


Your Perks

$2: Two High Fives from TMC!

Give $2 and you'll be in on future campaign updates, and you'll know that you are, indeed, awesome. If we meet you in person, we will definitely consider high-fiving you, twice.

$20: Gift Code

Give $20 and we will send you a coupon code that you can redeem on our online shop - foodforesters.org . We will send you the code in time for your holiday season shopping too...

$50: Gift Certificate

Give $50 and you get a real, snail-mailed TMC gift certificate (delivery late November 2013), redeemable online, or in-person at TMC if attend a workshop or eat at our boutique restaurant. If you let us know, we will include a message so you can make this into a practical gift (that gives twice) for someone special.

$100: Adopt a Tree

In a few short years, visitors to The Molina Center will be able to walk in one of the most extensive food forests in the USA. As part of creating our food forest, we will be planting at least 1000 trees - big and small - over the next few years. We want to make a visit to our forest a fun, educational and interactive experience. Your adopted tree will have a small NFC enabled tag on which visitors can tap their smartphone to view details about the tree - it's species, ecological niche and human use, plus view your own customizable message (which could be text, a photo, a video - anything you can link to on the internet!). Your tree's visitors can even leave you a message or a photo of your tree... We will setup your NFC tag and virtual content by Summer 2014, but tags will be assigned to trees as they are planted on a first-come-first-served basis. They sooner you claim your perk, the sooner your tree will be in the ground! Our website will also have an interactive map of the food forest available for people to virtually visit your tree.

$500: Sponsor a Quilt Patch

In the foyer to the Administration Center, there will be a large (5x7 feet) handmade quilt. Your patch (approx 5x8 inches) will have your name and/or short message embroidered on it and will be seen by every visitor to TMC forever... Only 100 patches are available, the quilt will be made in early 2014.

$1,000: Adopt a Solar Panel

As soon as possible, we want TMC to be producing all of it's own electricity from the abundant solar energy here in Colorado. To do that, we need to build an array of 200 solar panels. We will have a real-time display of energy generation in our foyer, where individual panels will be shown. Your name will be shown on your panel, and you will also be able to share your panel's CO2 offsetting prowess with your friends via the Internet. Our website will also contain an interactive map of our installation, which can include your name and/or a link of your choosing. Like the trees, panels will be assigned to adopters on a first-come-first-served basis. Our arrays will be built in four stages, we will build the stages that are fully funded by this campaign in early 2014, otherwise we will seek further funds to complete the array as soon as possible and keep you informed throughout the process.

$5,000: Edibly Landscape Your Place

Once we have our Food Foresters team skilled up, they will be available to create edible landscapes anywhere. This major perk will get you at least $5000 off the price of bringing the team to your home or business and implementing a permaculture design to secure your local and organic food supply. Due to time and resource restraints - and that we want to ensure that we can deliver in 2014, only 4 of these are available.

$10,000: Colorado Adventure for Two

Let's face it - The Molina Center is located in an awesome part of the world. Who doesn't want to come to Colorado and get the VIP treatment for 5 days? Come and stay with us and we will arrange trips to locations of your choice from Aspen, Telluride, Powderhorn Resort, hiking or cross-country skiing on the Grand Mesa, Arches National Park, Colorado National Monument and Black Canyon of the Gunnison National Park, plus open access to any workshops and events that are on while you are here.  We can only do this twice... do you prefer Summer or Winter?

Spread the Word and Be Rewarded

Just because you're not up to giving some money and collecting a perk, doesn't mean you can't help out and make a difference. Even better - we have partnered with some smart innovative companies to offer you awesome referral prizes!


AquaFarm is made by Back To The Roots in Oakland CA and retails for $59.99, while the Windowfarm is from Windowfarms and you will get the "One-Column Starter Bundle" which retails for $199.00. Both of these products grew out of successful crowdfunding campaigns and we plan to use them extensively in our programs. You should receive your prize in time for Christmas 2013.

The Genesis Dosing Controller is created by Sustainable Microfarms and their Indiegogo crowdfunding campaign is launching September 2013. It will retail for over $700 and will ship to you in early 2014. Again, this is a product which we plan to use in our programs into the future.

If you are not from the USA and win a referral prize, keep in mind that key parts of these products won't be able to be shipped to you (growing media, seeds, etc.) - we will let you know if you are affected and how to source the missing organic components locally.

How to Share Our Campaign (so we can track your rewards)

  • Go to our Indiegogo campaign page (you're looking at it now!)
  • Login (you may need to sign up first, or login with your Facebook account to do it faster)
  • Use any of the sharing tools in the "Share this Campaign" section right below our video
As long as you are logged in when you use the sharing tools, we can keep track of all the people you have referred and how much they have contributed and you will be automatically counted for rewards.

Hence this crowdfunding campaign. After several years of planning, hundreds of  thousands of dollars worth of private financial and in-kind donations and support, we are coming out of "stealth mode" and asking for your - the general public's - support.
As soon as we reach $30,000 on this campaign, we can start our programs.
However - we need to raise $300,000 to be sure that we can continue operations in the long term - we will be working intensely to push our campaign to this goal!  Raising up to or beyond $300,000 will ensure that we have enough to fund operations well into 2015 and convince grant-making foundations that we are a safe investment, so that we can continue to inspire many more at-risk youth into the future.
If you can't afford a donation, then share this with your friends. Even just talking about us - saying "check out The Molina Center, they are doing cool stuff" to everyone you know - will make a real difference to our collective future. Check out our Referral Prizes shown at the end of this page to see how we will thank you for your support.
Where the Money Goes:

Your Perks
$2: Two High Fives from TMC!
Give $2 and you'll be in on future campaign updates, and you'll know that you are, indeed, awesome. If we meet you in person, we will definitely consider high-fiving you, twice.
$20: Gift Code
Give $20 and we will send you a coupon code that you can redeem on our online shop - foodforesters.org . We will send you the code in time for your holiday season shopping too...
$50: Gift Certificate
Give $50 and you get a real, snail-mailed TMC gift certificate (delivery late November 2013), redeemable online, or in-person at TMC if attend a workshop or eat at our boutique restaurant. If you let us know, we will include a message so you can make this into a practical gift (that gives twice) for someone special.
$100: Adopt a Tree
In a few short years, visitors to The Molina Center will be able to walk in one of the most extensive food forests in the USA. As part of creating our food forest, we will be planting at least 1000 trees - big and small - over the next few years. We want to make a visit to our forest a fun, educational and interactive experience. Your adopted tree will have a small NFC enabled tag on which visitors can tap their smartphone to view details about the tree - it's species, ecological niche and human use, plus view your own customizable message (which could be text, a photo, a video - anything you can link to on the internet!). Your tree's visitors can even leave you a message or a photo of your tree... We will setup your NFC tag and virtual content by Summer 2014, but tags will be assigned to trees as they are planted on a first-come-first-served basis. They sooner you claim your perk, the sooner your tree will be in the ground! Our website will also have an interactive map of the food forest available for people to virtually visit your tree.
$500: Sponsor a Quilt Patch
In the foyer to the Administration Center, there will be a large (5x7 feet) handmade quilt. Your patch (approx 5x8 inches) will have your name and/or short message embroidered on it and will be seen by every visitor to TMC forever... Only 100 patches are available, the quilt will be made in early 2014.
$1,000: Adopt a Solar Panel
As soon as possible, we want TMC to be producing all of it's own electricity from the abundant solar energy here in Colorado. To do that, we need to build an array of 200 solar panels. We will have a real-time display of energy generation in our foyer, where individual panels will be shown. Your name will be shown on your panel, and you will also be able to share your panel's CO2 offsetting prowess with your friends via the Internet. Our website will also contain an interactive map of our installation, which can include your name and/or a link of your choosing. Like the trees, panels will be assigned to adopters on a first-come-first-served basis. Our arrays will be built in four stages, we will build the stages that are fully funded by this campaign in early 2014, otherwise we will seek further funds to complete the array as soon as possible and keep you informed throughout the process.
$5,000: Edibly Landscape Your Place
Once we have our Food Foresters team skilled up, they will be available to create edible landscapes anywhere. This major perk will get you at least $5000 off the price of bringing the team to your home or business and implementing a permaculture design to secure your local and organic food supply. Due to time and resource restraints - and that we want to ensure that we can deliver in 2014, only 4 of these are available.
$10,000: Colorado Adventure for Two
Let's face it - The Molina Center is located in an awesome part of the world. Who doesn't want to come to Colorado and get the VIP treatment for 5 days? Come and stay with us and we will arrange trips to locations of your choice from Aspen, Telluride, Powderhorn Resort, hiking or cross-country skiing on the Grand Mesa, Arches National Park, Colorado National Monument and Black Canyon of the Gunnison National Park, plus open access to any workshops and events that are on while you are here.  We can only do this twice... do you prefer Summer or Winter?
Spread the Word and Be Rewarded
Just because you're not up to giving some money and collecting a perk, doesn't mean you can't help out and make a difference. Even better - we have partnered with some smart innovative companies to offer you awesome referral prizes!



AquaFarm is made by Back To The Roots in Oakland CA and retails for $59.99, while the Windowfarm is from Windowfarms and you will get the "One-Column Starter Bundle" which retails for $199.00. Both of these products grew out of successful crowdfunding campaigns and we plan to use them extensively in our programs. You should receive your prize in time for Christmas 2013.
The Genesis Dosing Controller is created by Sustainable Microfarms and their Indiegogo crowdfunding campaign is launching September 2013. It will retail for over $700 and will ship to you in early 2014. Again, this is a product which we plan to use in our programs into the future.
If you are not from the USA and win a referral prize, keep in mind that key parts of these products won't be able to be shipped to you (growing media, seeds, etc.) - we will let you know if you are affected and how to source the missing organic components locally.
How to Share Our Campaign (so we can track your rewards)


Go to our Indiegogo campaign page (you're looking at it now!)
Login (you may need to sign up first, or login with your Facebook account to do it faster)
Use any of the sharing tools in the "Share this Campaign" section right below our video

As long as you are logged in when you use the sharing tools, we can keep track of all the people you have referred and how much they have contributed and you will be automatically counted for rewards.

story:
About ReSign

ReSign was launched in January 2013 (under the umbrella of GREAN Palestine) to become the first professional recycling project in Bethlehem district by reusing waste and turning it into a variety of useful and artistic products.

GREAN Palestine stands for GrassRoots Environmental Action Netwpork Palestine.  It is a networking and fundraising structure that promotes and supports the work of Palestinian environmental activists.  GREAN Palestine is an entirely volunteer-run organisation with zero over-heads - thus all money raised is passed directly to grassroots projects. 

To see ReSign on Facebook, please follow this link:

https://www.facebook.com/Resign.pal

To read more about GREAN Palestine, please look up this link:

https://www.facebook.com/GREANPalestine

To read GREAN Palestine’s latest report, please follow this link:

http://pdfcast.org/pdf/grassroot-environmental-action-network-palestine-2013-report


Project background:

The production of waste is currently a global problem and the situation in Palestine is no exception.  According to the Palestinian Central Bureau of Statistics, the average waste per person is 600 grams daily.  The majority of this waste will either be thrown into landfills or burnt in the urban areas, both of which result in health and environmental problems.  However, there is limited understanding of these problems amongst the population and therefore a lack of awareness of the benefits that come from recycling.

This project offers a tangible solution to reducing waste production, whilst simultaneously educating people about the problems caused by waste and what they can do about it.  


Aims of the project:

Your contributions will help build the first specialized up-cycling workshop in Palestine. When this workshop is full of equipment and material, it will be the place where several Palestinian and international up-cycling artists will come to make products out of waste. Their art work will be promoted and sent back to markets to go back to houses instead of being thrown in a dumpster. 

This workshop will be an active resource to spread awareness about the environmental problems associated with waste production by encouraging reusing, recycling/ upcycling and reducing household waste.  The team will also teach interested communities the skills necessary to up-cycle waste into beneficial products and spread the culture of recycling as artistic work.

Once the project is started, it will generate its own funds through the marketing of products and through undertaking paid consultancies and projects - so we just need this small push to set the ball rolling!   We are aiming for financial sustainability within 6 months.

By the way, all the gifts in this kickstarter will be made by ReSign, using the tools bought from your valuable donations...so, you are a part of it :)


What We Need & What You Get

So, to build this workshop, we need the following tools:

NB. Prices were collected from 3 stores in the town of Beit Sahour. Every dollar you donate will be spent on developing this workshop and providing it with something useful to make things.

The decoration and the furniture needed for the workshop will be made from up-cycled material.  Furthermore, we will also build different tools which are not available in the market, but can be designed with the help of your donations.

Tools

Cost 

in USD

Angle-Grinder saw (2 sizes)

250

Trimming Saw

270

Electric grindstone

120

Vertical saw

135

Water pump table saw

 420

Hand electric drill x 2

 285

Rechargeable screw driver

210

Mini mill drill

255

2 diamond disks (for glass)

210

Gas welding machine with gas pipes

300

Diamond driller cores

180

Drill taps and dies for wood, metal and glass in different sizes

120

Sanding machine

325

Parts to build a mixer for sanding broken glass

283

Miscellaneous materials and equipment (staplers, glue, sand paper, sawing disks, screws, nails, paint, wire) and other hand tools (brushes, pliers, pinchers, screw drivers, hammers)..etc

500

Rotary tool kit

192
Rent of the workshop for 6 months
 150*6 (900)

Other expenses (contingency) + percentage deducted from IndieGoGo

600
Total: $5555 and i know we can make them :)

For now, this is the goal.  If we don't get lucky enough to reach the goal, whatever we collect will be spent to get as many tools as possible to start with.  The tools in the list are the most important which we need to work with different types of waste products.

If we get lucky and get more money than the goal, we will be happy and get more tools!  Be sure that the more tools we get, the more waste we can get off the street and get it back as beautiful and useful inside houses...we can educate more people on how to make up-cycling...the project can be as bigger the more we invest in it. 

Also, when you donate over $120, your award will be made by ReSign with the tools we will purchase from your donations. It will be a green handmade award that will make you feel related and connected to the project!

The Impact

Why ReSign:

FIRST OF ITS KIND
ReSign will be the first professional initiative to deal with waste as a resource of raw material in the West Bank area, the first place where up-cycling artists can come and be involved in the development of the project and the products.

TEACHING AND TRAINING
As a part of GREAN Palestine, ReSign holds responisbilty for spreading the up-cycling and reusing culture in the community.

Another way of training is to offer people the chance to make their own products: learning how to make things step by step at the workshop. It's always more fun to make the gift you are giving to someone with your own hands than just buying it..right?!

RESPONSIBLE INVESTMENT
The products that are made by ReSign will be exhibited for purchase and marketed in different ways. A part of the profit (5-10%) of the sales will be used to reach different groups and communities and teach them about up-cycling. Since last year, ReSign managed to give 8 trainings: 3 of them were financed by ReSign's budget. We also had 10 exhibitions!

The rest of the income will be used to develop and improve the workshop, covering the costs and providing it with more tools, besides paying the artists for their work and encouraging them to make more work.

STREET ART
One of the main strategies for both marketing and serving the community will be making larger pieces and distributing them around the town of Beit Sahour in the beginning, later moving to other towns.  For example: big seats, statues, art work made of wood, old tires, metal and any other available materials. This way, we can spread the word wider and get more people interested in our work!

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help us with your money for sure, but more than this, we need to network: to be known. You can help by sharing and recommending our project. Don't forget to like our page, review our news and see our products by visiting our facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/Resign.pal

Thanks a lot for reading and helping!

For more information, please don't hesitate to contact us through the facebook page, or our email : resign.pal@gmail.com

Ask anything you want, and we are ready to answer you with pleasure :)

story:
A Thousand Voices to Cool The World

Summary

When voices are raised in song – they have power beyond the spoken word. Historically, we have seen how songs raise consciousness, cultivate change and inspire action (towards fighting aids, hunger -  think "We are the World"). Cool the World transcends geography, language and socio-economic boundaries. It will be sung by the voices of those who stand to lose the most if we don't cool this planet: children.

  • We'll create compelling content: footage of kids singing CTW in their native languages, tagged with vignettes of how climate change has effected their areas. (5 - 7  minute investigative reports with KIDS as the focus.)
  • We will work with NGO's, educators, businesses to leverage this content in local markets to raise awareness
  • in tandem with this, we'll pursue exploration of using Cool the World as tag for 90 second spots that speak to the GOOD that is going on with companies. Most sustainability reports and plans are not read by the average customer - they consume without knowing. THis is a missed opportunity.

We're betting that business leaders will pay attention to this - beyond doomsday statistics.

What's at Stake?

Most of us feel distant from the impacts of global warming. Our children will not have that luxury. Many insects, plants, foods, and animals will not endure the climate change over the next 50 years. Extinction effects our entire ecosystem in devastating ways. The  comfort, enjoyment and vitality of our children's lives are at stake. They understand. They are concerned. Now is the time to send the urgent message to those who have the power to cool the world - in big and small ways. Thank you for being a part this solution. Raising awareness is a huge challenge. This song sung by thousands of voices will cool the world. Business owners will hear the call, as will world leaders. And we’ll reach a tipping point of change. This is our vision.

The Impact

How will Cool the World impact people and the issues of global warming?

  • It will engage young people all over the world to raise their voices in one song, with one message: cool the world.
  • It will be a marketing tool for any organization on the front lines of advocacy
  • It will give these young voices a powerful platform from which to beautifully express their united front against the continuation of irresponsible behaviors that harm the environme'nt
  • It will foster cross-cultural and intergenerational conversations about global warming
  • It will engage the media to consider the effects of global warming in the context of how they impact young lives all over the planet
  • It will make the global warming issue personal and emotional – and that has to happen in order to motivate individuals to become stakeholders and game changers by shifting their own behaviors.

Artists for Literacy (.org) was founded in 2000 to tackle illiteracy in this country. We sold over 30,000 CD's to raise awareness of and money for free literacy programs. We mobilized over 1000 songwriters into action through contests, and garnered the support of Bruce Springsteen, David Bowie, Tom Waits, Roseanne Cash, and Suzanne Vega. We had coverage by the NY Times, Wall Street Journal, Rolling Stone, Billboard, and NPR.

We know how to produce campaigns that make an impact. 

What We Need & What You Get

When we raise this $36,000, it will ‘kick-start’ the development of A Thousand Voices to Cool the World. The team assembled will include Artists for Literacy, joined by a business development team, a technical team, and a production coordinator. It will also immediately secure the services of a PR/Marketing team to plan and execute on a Phase 1 promotion campaign that will ensure our efforts are not kept secret at any time in the production process. It will enable us to start coordinating the participation of choirs from around the country and world.

If you have a company that would do well by supporting this campaign – please give more generously than you would as an individual - and contact me directly. By leveraging your existing infrastructure, we won’t need to re-invent the wheel. We'll do right by this project together.

Cool the World is a project of Artists for Literacy. Your investment will be tax-deductable. Please give NOW while you are here on this page. Life has a way of getting in the way!

PLEASE share our campaign page with your own social network (along with a personal note from you). The tools are above - right under the video. When you do, your investment in the project will grow exponentially. That's how crowd funding works. Your friends will care about this project, too, and want to make an investment. But they have to know about it first.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute right now, even $1, that doesn’t mean you don't bring value!
Share our campaign page with your own social network. Use the share tools above!
Please contact cooltheworld.org to learn about volunteer opportunities.

Thank you Nutribullet. They donated their top-of-the-line blender for the FIVE $500 investors.
Thank you DrumCafeWest.com for donating an amazing perk for the THREE $2500 investors.

Thank you all so much for your interest, investment and enthusiasm.

Together, we’ll cool the world with a thousand voices...and beyond.

Deborah Pardes

 

Production Credits

The first Cool the World Choir you see singing here is made up of 20 kids who live in Los Angeles. They and their families recently volunteered their time to learn and record this song. Serena Creative, Inc. donated the production of the video. Emoto Music, Inc. donated their recording facility, their musicians, and their production skills. I donated my time to wrtie the song, organize, rehearse and direct the choir and now plan to take this project’s potential further. Indeed, it took a magnificent, creative village to produce the first Cool the World Choir. I am lucky to live in this village, and from this fertile place, I’d like to continue to cool the world with a thousand additional young voices from around the country and planet.

By the way, all the renditions of ‘Cool the World’ will be sung in the same key (C), to the same beats per minute (98). The mash-up possibilities are endless and full of electrifying potential.

You can download a audio only version of the song here.

The Cool the World Los Angeles Band:

Paul Bessenbacher - guitar
James Neil - drums
Jon Steinmeier  - piano
Carlen Walth - bass
Will Hampton - engineer
 
Composer: Deborah Pardes

The Cool the World Los Angeles Singers:

Adam Goodwin
Lucie O'Brien 
Sabine Paris
Georges Paris
India Jade Dyer
Eloise Jacott
Emmaline Jacott
Dominic Bagnato Barker
Yasmine Gruber-Mendoza
Gabriella Delacasas
Lola Ellenberg
Eden Ellenberg
Melusine Maury
Gianna Skye
Olivia Louis-Marie
Tess Goddard
Lily Goddard
Noa Goldsmith
Isola Serena
Hanna Harrell

I am lucky to live in this village, and from this fertile place, I’d like to continue to cool the world with a thousand additional young voices from around the country and planet.
By the way, all the renditions of ‘Cool the World’ will be sung in the same key (C), to the same beats per minute (98). The mash-up possibilities are endless and full of electrifying potential.
You can download a audio only version of the song here.
The Cool the World Los Angeles Band:
Paul Bessenbacher - guitar
James Neil - drums
Jon Steinmeier  - piano
Carlen Walth - bass
Will Hampton - engineer
 
Composer: Deborah Pardes
The Cool the World Los Angeles Singers:
Adam GoodwinLucie O'Brien Sabine ParisGeorges ParisIndia Jade DyerEloise JacottEmmaline JacottDominic Bagnato BarkerYasmine Gruber-MendozaGabriella DelacasasLola EllenbergEden EllenbergMelusine MauryGianna SkyeOlivia Louis-MarieTess GoddardLily GoddardNoa GoldsmithIsola SerenaHanna Harrell

story:
Bicycl'Est c'est notre défi Européen ! 


Voilà en quelques mots comment on pourrait résumer notre projet. 

Un défi sportif puisque nous allons parcourir la distance Dijon-Budapest en vélo, mais aussi un défi pédagogique. En effet la petite équipe des 10 étudiants que nous formons ne part pas seulement faire un tour de l'Europe, elle part filmer, photographier, interviewer l'Europe jusqu'à Budapest pendant 21 jours. En somme, nous avons pour dessein de créer un reportage qui présenterait l'Europe d'une façon un peu insolite, une Europe que l'on ne connait pas vraiment et dont on entend pas souvent parler : l'Europe de la diversité culturelle. 

"L'Europe : Unité dans la diversité?"

 C'est la question à laquelle nous avons choisi de répondre dans notre reportage. Quelle Histoire chaque pays va-t-il nous raconter ? Quels monuments chaque ville a-t-elle à nous présenter ? Quelles spécialités culinaires chaque village va-t-il nous faire déguster ? Quelle vision de l'Europe chaque citoyenva-t-il nous donner ?            Bien que l'Europe soit un projet politique, elle porte en son sein une caractéristique qui fait à la fois sa force, son impétuosité mais aussi son unité, une caractéristique que l'on néglige souvent : la diversité. Nous avons choisi d'aller à la recherche de cette diversité et de la présenter dans notre reportage. 

Grâce à cette expérience nous volons vivre une aventure Européenne que nous souhaitons partager au sein des collèges et lycées afin d'éveiller un sentiment européen chez les citoyens les plus jeunes. 

 Toute l'équipe Bicycl'Est compte sur votre générosité, il n'y a pas de petits dons ! Toutefois si vous ne pouvez pas nous aider alors partagez notre projet ! 

 Retrouvez-nous sur notre blog !

story:
In 2013 the Liverpool Bay Marine Life Trust helped the Sea Watch Foundation in the first cetacean survey of Liverpool Bay.The survey was a great success and we were able to spot and photo ID many dolphins in the area.

Far more research into this population is needed though, especially with sightings of these animals on the rise.

With your help we can run more surveys in Liverpool Bay, document our dolphins and work to protect them.

Each £500 we raise will cover the cost of chartering our boat for one Survey. All other funds raised can then be put towards future projects.


You can make a big difference to our research by contributing and helping us reach our goal and have the opportunity to join us on our survey in Liverpol Bay.

Please support this project in anyway you can and please share it with your friends.Your help is vital to our research in Liverpool Bay and to helping us monitor our fantastic marine biodiversity

www.facebook.com/liverpoolbaymarinelifetrust
www.twitter.com/lbmlt
www.liverpoolbaymlt.org

story:
Stop the Construction of the Oil Terminal

Tesoro-Savage is planning to build a 42 acre oil terminal in our town, Vancouver, WA.  The proposed project would have the capability to handle up to 380,000 barrels of crude per day, making it the largest oil facility of its kind in the country.  The crude would be transferred by rail, using tanker cars that the NTSB considered dangerous and inadequate in 1991.  We need your help to rent scientific monitoring equipment in order to prove, beyond a shadow of a doubt, the dangerous threat this terminal poses to our community and residents. 

Equipment We Are Seeking

1) FLIR Gasfindir hydrocarbon video camera $1,500 to rent for 5 days.
http://www.environmental-rental.com/Page/Default.aspx?Page=Page4
There are plenty of videos on Youtube which show how this camera works and it is the most underutilized industry tool.  We just received a promise from an environmental equipment rental business to borrow a FLIR GF320.  However, the details have not been worked out yet.  This piece of equipment is the key to stopping the oil terminal by proving that hazardous air emissions from crude oil trains exist and need to be included in the proposed Tesoro-Savage permit as a significant revision.  Should this donation fall through, it will be exponentially more difficult to make our case.

2) Light Spectrometer from Public Lab $70
http://store.publiclab.org/collections/spectrometry/products/smartphone-spectrometer
http://www.publiclab.org/wiki/spectrometer
(we currently have this model on short-term loan and should begin posting data March 24, 2014)

3) Bucket Brigade air monitoring program from Global Community Monitor $5,000-$7,500
http://www.gcmonitor.org/

Other Ways You Can Help:

We have formed a community organization, Vancouver Action Network.  If you live in the area, you can donate your time.  We have weekly meetings to discuss how you can assist us with monitoring and informing the public.  Please visit our Facebook page at
https://www.facebook.com/VancouverActionNetwork.

If you are a 501(c)(3) nonprofit, we are actively seeking a fiscal sponsor for grants.  If you are interested in helping, please contact us at vancouveractionnetwork@gmail.com.

story:
Towards a Better World


If people are able to visualize how their garbage can come back into the system, then they are going to recycle. From this methodology, we came out with our Campaign Concept “Shu Aslak”.

Shu Aslak will be a campaign that will show people the outcome of recycling, what they can benefit from it and how this will affect their life. We will be raising the awareness about recycling benefits in a fresh, exciting and creative manner.


we are a team of 3 People that care about environment. Me a Channel Manager, My Friend a Marketing Manager and our friend a Graphic Designer. we decided to launch a digital marketing campaign Called Shu Aslak...  in case we were able to get the needed funds, “Shu Aslak” will be a 2 months online campaign  aiming to raise the awareness about recycling benefits in a fresh, exciting and creative manner.

This campaign seeks to visualize the outcome of the recycling in order to generate a significant impact on the audience when they know what items can be produced from their garbage. Our campaign will be based on Digital Communication channels such as: Social media platforms (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, You-tube, etc…), Web-banner ad campaigns, Email campaigns, Micro-site, Mobile App., Game and videos.

The target audience for our campaign will be online users from age of 5 till 35. Our main reason to target the audience from the age of 5 is that they are the new generation, and if they are raised on the idea of recycling, they will be on the right track towards a better society and healthy environment. As for the grownups, this campaign will be as the awareness campaign for them to educate them about the benefit of recycling and how easy it is to work for a better life just by separating their garbage.

Action Plan:

Campaign

Time

Goals

Strategy

Teasing Online Banner

Week 1

Grab internet users attention

Post those Banners with adsense and on most visited websites, Newsletters websites and some TV websites

2nd Online Banner

Week 2 & 3

Post 1st banner answer and link to the micro-site

To give the audience the answer about the teasing banner and offer them more details about our mission through our micro-site

Launch Social Media Platform Campaign

Week 2

Launch Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and foursquare accounts

Facebook: To Share activities; spread the awareness, share videos, post, discussion boards, etc…

Twitter: To share activities; spread the awareness, share video, links, posts, micro-site link and to launch hash-tags: #recycling, #Shu-Aslak, #Pixel, etc.

Instagram: To share photos of recycled items and recycle places

Foursquare: We will check in from our foursquare account wherever we will find a recycling container and trash separators in a way to support the place we visit and we will leave a tip about the place in order to spread the word and direct the people that are interested in recycling to drop off there

Micro-site

Week 2 till the end of the Campaign

To educate the audience about the benefit of recycling and the impact on their life

The micro-site will include the below sections:
- About our campaign
- Explore recycling

- why/what to recycle

- Recycle process

- What Do Your Recyclables Become?

- Contribution section

- Links to our social medial platforms

- Download app

Application

Week 2

To Launch Recycle Drop-off locator + Request garbage separator containers App

- To help users easy locate the nearest drop-off spot where they can drop off their separated garbage

- To allow users to request special bags and containers to easily separate their garbage

Video (1)

Week 2

Post 30 seconds video

The video will be shared on our social media platforms to increase the awareness about our campaign and recycling

Email Marketing

Week 3

The mail shot will be include an info-graphic design about recycling that will be sent through outsourced company that has the exposure over more than 10,000 contacts in Lebanon

To attract more users to check our campaign and encourage them toward recycle – Link to micro-site + link to download App.

Video (2)

Week 4

Post 30 seconds video

The video will be shared on our social media platforms to increase the awareness about our campaign and recycling

Info graphic Banner

Week 4

Post info graphic page on the micro-site and the social media platforms

There will be a design presented like info graphics for each of the 3 campaigns relevant to the title "Shu Aslak", a form of creating what the mass recycling of an item can become and translating it in a local context like the village, family, etc.

The designs will be available on the micro-site and social media platforms and the approach will be humorous and relatable, however there will also be room for statistical studies in numbers to showcase evident facts about the nature of recycling per item.

Evaluation

Week 8

Evaluate the campaign and collect Database

Share the data base of people that are interested in recycling with the NGO’s and trash collectors companies in order to communicate with them all recycling campaigns, information and activities

Teasing Campaign Banner 1


Banner 2


Micro-Site Prototype

Mobile App Prototype


Thank you!!!
Shu Aslak Team

story:
Who Is Golden Eagle And What Are Water Ceremonies?

Marshall "Golden Eagle" Jack is a member of the Washoe Tribe of California and Nevada. He is affiliated with the Southern Paiute and Central Miwok Tribes. Family history includes great-grandparents and grandparents who were medicine people and healers. Marshall is one of the few medicine persons who carry the original teachings passed down through many generations of ancestors.

Marshall has trained extensively underneath spiritual and medicine Elders, from the Washoe, Shoshone, Paiute, and Miwok nations since 1960. Spiritual Leader/Advisor, Ceremonial Leader and Healer.

Ceremony leadership encompasses:

Leading persons and spirits through birth, joining in marriage, death and beyond. Ceremonies include blessing of homes and sacred sites such as petroglyphs, ancient ruins and burial sites. He has been called upon to be adviser for personal, family and Tribal affairs. On request, prayer and healing ceremonies are done in homes and designated sacred areas. Golden Eagle Ceremonies

Other ceremonies frequently done are listed below:

Consecration of Sweatlodges, Pipe Ceremonies, Master of Ceremony in various Native American events, Preservation of Sacred Sites through Ceremony, Bear Ceremony,Healing Ceremony, Drum Ceremony, Song Ceremony, Fasting Ceremony and Vision Quest Leader




What Is So Important About These Ceremonies At Lake Titicaca?

The Living Universe Podcast Interview with Golden Eagle below explains more about the powerful galactic convergence and cardinal cross this month and why it is so important to hold these ceremonies at Lake Titicaca!


Lake Titicaca is one of the bodies of water (lakes) on the Earths grid system. This 9 pointed star crystalline grid was activated in 2010. With this powerful galactic convergence with of April 2014 a new crystalline grid is being activated and Lake Titicaca is a very powerful point in this new grid! Lake Titicaca is the polar feminine body of water on Earth, the womb space.

What is a Water Wheel? How Does it Work?

A Water Wheel is the sacred geometry design you see above. It is based on a Native American medicine wheel. Its purpose is to energize, celebrate, and honor water. It is also a place to deepen our relationship with the spirit of water.

A Water Wheel can be a personal altar in your home (Water Wheel Kit), or the design can be laid on the earth like a medicine wheel using corn meal, flowers, or stones. Seven clear quartz crystals activate six points around the circle and the center and transmit healing energy to and from the wheel.

Water Wheels are activated by our thoughts, intentions, and clear quartz crystals to create an energy field, or vortex of consciousness, for energizing water. Water Wheels get our thoughts of love, gratitude, and appreciation, which have been scientifically proven to transform the very structure of water, flowing to water. The more love and energy the Water Wheel receives from us, the more energy goes out to help our source waters… from which all living things are fed.

What We Need To Make This Happen

Including Golden Eagle there is a core group of 6 people, native elders who hold the space for these water ceremonies and there are 2 other individuals who have been called to be part of these ceremonies at Lake Titicaca.

  • Round-trip planes tickets average $1,500 per person totaling $12,000
  • Quartz crystals to be used in these ceremonies which are mined in Bolivia and will be shipped across the world to shift the energetics of the Earth's grid in many other locations. Cost $5,000.
  • Any transport, lodging, food and other basic travel expenses for the group. Cost $4,000.
  • $1,000 for the cost to pay fees to Indiegogo for hosting this wonderful campaign.

If we do not receive the full funding for the campaign we will reduce the size of the group and the amount of crystals that will go to Lake Titicaca.

Our Gesture of Love

We would like to offer everyone who helps us make it to Lake Titicaca for the ceremonies infinite love and gratitude :) We also have some great perks to offer as gestures of love in return for your love and support! Everyone who pledges funds to our campaign receives the graphic story email of our magical Lake Titicaca ceremonies. The depending on how much you pledge you will receive more perks from us :)

  • Graphic story email of our magical Lake Titicaca Ceremonies.
  • Download access to pictures taken at the Lake Titicaca Ceremonies.
  • One Energetically charged ceremonial crystal.
  • Hand-full of the ceremonial crystals.
  • Tincture bottle of Lake Titicaca water.
  • Peruvian satchel.
  • Personal email of love and gratitude from Golden Eagle.

Help Us Spread the Message

If you cannot pledge any funds to help our campaign and you understand the importance and need to celebrate, energize, and honor the Earths waters then please spread the message, tell your, family, your friends! Post our Indiegogo campaign link on your Facebook wall for the world to see! You can also use the built-in Indiegogo share tools on this page!

story:
Providing Composting Toilets to Los Alvarez in Santa Lucia, Boaco, Nicaragua to improve health, protect water and provide valuable organic compost

The campaign has ended.

See updates for reports, photos and videos from the field.

You can also still donate directly through EWB-USA.

https://ssl.charityweb.net/ewbusa/

Using these instructions:

Check box: Would you like to make this gift in honor or in memory of someone? If so, please check this box and fill in the fields that appear.

Choose State: California

Choose Chapter: SAN FRANCISCO PROFESSIONAL CHAPTER

Choose: Chapter General Fund

Complete: "This donation is made" by selecting "in honor of"
Complete blank field with "ATDT composting toilets"
Fill out the rest of the fields and submit your donation.
Thanks!


EWB-San Francisco Professionals Appropriate Technology Design Team (EWB-SFP ATDT) needs your help to fund the next sets of composting toilets with the community of Los Alvarez in Santa Lucia, Boaco, Nicaragua.

For every $3000 we raise, we'll deploy ten redesigned composting latrines.

Engineers Without Borders-USA (EWB-USA) supports community-driven development programs worldwide through the design and implementation of sustainable engineering projects while fostering responsible leadership.

EWB-SFP ATDT is a group of MEs, EEs and other product development professionals who provide engineering design and research assistance for projects in developing communities throughout the world.




(Map above courtesy of Google)

The Need

The community of Los Alvarez consists of 134 families and has a population of approximately 938 inhabitants. The residents have a sanitation problem caused by the inadequate latrines traditionally used. Before the composting toilets  project, 95% of its latrines were in poor condition (127 families have problems with traditional latrines).  These latrines flood with water during the winter and fail in the summer due to a weakened internal structure. Because of this, inhabitants experience a high rate of illnesses due to exposure to fecal matter and water contamination.The environment is polluted and inhabitants are exposed to physical harm due to the high probability of latrine collapse.

Project Goals

The main goals of this project are: 

  • Build on the successful pilot program and deploy more composting toilets with families, in sets of ten, until all the families in need are successfully maintaining their composting toilets and using the organic compost for their crops. 
  • Change the negative image of organic compost obtained from human excrement that exists in the culture.
  • Implement environmental sanitation methods to protect the community’s water sources, which are the Fonseca River’s springs (river that supplies the potable water to the Boaco Region).
  • Successfully execute the project and administer the funds acquired for the composting toilets. Issue a project report for each phase.

Background 

In 2010 EWB-SFP ATDT contacted Outreach International for a possible project location after a project in another country did not materialize. Outreach International (OI) partnered with Alcance Nicaragua (AN) and Alvarez Co-op (Cooperativa de Autogestión Hermanos en Acción RL)  for the initial location for the composting latrines. Alcance Nicaragua is one of the in-country field programs of Outreach International. 

Participants

The EWB Response

In spring 2010 ATDT visited the community and discussed various composting toilet designs during a community workshop coordinated through Alvarez Co-op and AN with the support of OI. Based on the experience of a local leader, a two-vault above-ground system was selected. This design met the goal of the project and resolved the issue of latrines flooding during the winter and collapsing in the summer.

In Fall 2010, ATDT team members presented the design and materials list.  AN managed the project though the Alvarez Co-op. Alvarez Co-op managed the materials purchase and transportation, identified 15 homes (based on survey data) and prioritized ten beneficiaries based on criteria of: latrine condition, number of people, type of soil, financial situation, and commitment to project.

In January 2011, ten composting latrines were built, benefiting 47 people from 10 families. AN organized working groups which consisted of the project beneficiaries and their families. Graceland University Students who were spending their winter term in 2011 with Alcance Nicaragua contributed significant labor for the excavation and toilet foundation and construction of the composting toilets.

Workshops were conducted on the use and maintenance of the composting latrines. Participants included the ten beneficiaries, Alvarez Co-op members, youths involved with the construction, members of the Llanito Co-op,  EWB-SFP ATDT members, and a team from AN.

2013-2014 Assessment results
The pilot project has been monitored by Alvarez Co-op and AN. After three years of use, the composting toilets are working great. User acceptance has been high. On average, families harvest organic fertilizer with a value of ~$77 per cycle. More families in  the community want to replace their traditional latrines with composting toilets. The composting toilet has been redesigned, reducing the cost per toilet by half to ~$300 – less than the cost of a conventional latrine, which needs to be replaced annually. 

See prototype redesigned toilet below:


See the video below for Daniel, a satisfied user's experience.



Moving Forward
ATDT is fundraising for an August 2014 trip to deploy ten more of the redesigned composting toilets and another ten toilets on the next trip. We plan future campaigns and trips for all the families that need them. We are also looking at additional communities with sanitation needs. The more funds we raise, the more families we can help.

We need your financial support

  • For every $3000 we raise, we'll deploy ten more composting toilets. In this campaign, if we make our goal we could do two more sets.
  • Alcance Nicaragua is identifying participants in Los Alvarez and El Llanito.
  • Participants will contribute 40-50% of the total cost of the latrine over a period of 18-24 months
  • The goal is to build four composting toilets concurrently over four days (12 days to build 10)
  • Construction is tentatively scheduled from mid-August to September, 2014

If we don't reach our entire goal, the funds we do raise will be used to deliver as many composting toilets as we can. We are seeking other funding sources as well.

If we exceed our funding goals, we will continue to work with our NGO partner on future trips to deliver toilets to all the families that need them including other communities.

Your contribution will make a difference!

Worldwide lack of sanitation is a major problem. Over 2.6 billion people don’t have access to toilets. The pilot project was a success and the community wants and needs more. You can personally make a difference with your contribution.

We thank you in advance for your support!!

As a token of our appreciation we will gift you with one or more of the items below:

  • Personalized certificate of appreciation, link to photos and videos of the implementation trip

  • PDF copy of "A Sewer Catastrophe Companion: Dry Toilets for Wet Disasters", the field-proven 5-gallon pail based composting approach for seismic or other emergency response situations


  • Gift certificate for parts for DIY 5-gallon pail based composting toilet

  • Copy of "The Humanure Handbook - A Guide to Composting Human Manure"
  • Opportunity to join us on the trip, help build it, scratch your name into the concrete slab for the  toilet you funded

Risks & Challenges

  • The design changes from the pilot units need to be validated and user feedback must be collected and analyzed. Lessons learned will be documented and applied to future versions.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute financially you can still help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools! 

To find out more information about EWB SFP or EWB USA please click on the links below!!

EWB-SFP

http://www.ewb-sfp.org/

EWB USA

http://www.ewb-usa.org/
